title: Bitmap Transformer
about:
As a weekend project for the full-stack JavaScript course at Code Fellows, I worked with a teammate to create an NPM install-able bitmap transformer. This package allows users to transform a non-palette bitmap image using simple command line arguments. Bitmaps can be transformed to either greyscale, a red hue, a mirrored image, all black, or inverted.

Includes: JavaScript, Node, Mocha, Chai, and Gulp

Source Code

title: Project Inoculation
about:
As the final project for the 301 level software developement course at Code Fellows, I worked with a team to create the "Project Inoculation" app. This tool allows users to search for K-12 schools in Washington and discover their vaccine excemption and completion rates.

Includes: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Page.js, Chart.js, Heroku, Firebase, MVC structure, mobile-first design

Source Code

title: Welcome to Seattle
about:
As the final project for the 201 level web developement course at Code Fellows, I worked with a team to create the "Welcome to Seattle" website. This tool is designed to help Seattle newcomers find the best neighborhood to meet thier needs.

Includes: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Local Storage

Source Code

title: App-a-thon
about:
As a founding Google Code Corps member, I helped pilot Google CS First at Boys & Girls Clubs in Portland, OR. I also planned and implemented a free hackathon for 45 club youth from across the metro area.

I recruited and trained 14 skilled volunteers who led small teams through the process of brainstorming, wire framing, and programming an Android app. We served two hearty meals, held a project fair, and provided our youth with certificates and resources on continuing with computer science.
